subject: Gardening
title: Sacrificial Planting for Slugs
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sacrificial Planting for Slugs.

hook.text: Slugs eat everything. But they prefer some things more than othersâ€”and that preference is your secret weapon.

buildup.text: Slugs prefer soft, low-growing leaves over tough or aromatic ones. They'll choose lettuce over rosemary every time.

discovery.text: Planting sacrificial lettuce or clover around vulnerable crops gives slugs their preferred mealâ€”and saves yours.

twist.text: The sacrificial border also concentrates slugs in one area, making hand-picking or trapping far more efficient.

climax.text: Fighting slugs is easier when you stop trying to exclude them and start managing where they eat.

punchline.text: Let slugs eat what you don't care about.

quiz.question: How does sacrificial planting help manage slugs?
options: The sacrificial plants produce chemicals that kill slugs
It gives slugs a preferred meal and concentrates them for easier control
Sacrificial plants grow faster and shade out slug habitats
